'Buenos Aires' ( or , ) is the capital and largest city of Argentina,
and the second-largest metropolitan area in South America, after Greater SÃ£o
Paulo. R.L. Forstall, R.P. Greene, and J.B. Pick, [http://www.uic.edu/cuppa-
/cityfutures/papers/webpapers/cityfuturespapers/session3_4/3_4whicharethe.pdf
"Which are the largest? Why published populations for major world urban areas
vary so greatly"], City Futures Conference, (University of Illinois at Chicago,
July 2004) â Table 5 (p.34) It is located on the western shore of the
estuary of the RÃ­o de la Plata, on the southeastern coast of the South American
continent. The Greater Buenos Aires conurbation, which also includes several
Buenos Aires Province districts, constitutes the third-largest conurbation in
Latin America, with a population of around thirteen million.

The city of Buenos Aires is not a part of Buenos Aires Province, nor is it the
Province's capital, but an autonomous district. In 1880, after decades of
political infighting, Buenos Aires was federalised and removed from Buenos Aires
Province. The city limits were enlarged to include the towns of Belgrano and
Flores (both are currently neighborhoods of the city). The 1994 constitutional
amendment granted the city autonomy, hence its formal name: 'Ciudad AutÃ³noma de
Buenos Aires' ('Autonomous City of Buenos Aires'). Its citizens first elected a
Chief of Government (i.e. Mayor) in 1996; before, the Mayor was directly
appointed by the President of the Republic.

Buenos Aires is rated one of the 20 largest cities in the world. It is, along
with SÃ£o Paulo and Mexico City, one of the three Latin American cities alpha
category for the study GaWC5 [http://www.lboro.ac.uk/gawc/world2010t.html
The World According to GaWC 2010]. Consultado el 15 de abril de 2012. and
has been ranked as the most important global city and competitive marketplace of
Latin America. Buenos Aires has the best quality of life in Latin America,
ranked at 61st in the world and its per capita income is among the three highest
in the region. [http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1137655-buenos-aires-con-la-mejor-
calidad-de-vida-de-la-region SegÃºn The Economist, Buenos Aires, con la mejor
calidad de vida de la regiÃ³n]. La NaciÃ³n, 10 de junio de 2009. Consultado el 15
de abril de 2012. [http://www.observatoriodegobierno.buenosaires.gob.-
ar/images/indicadores/2010/indicadorOtrasCiudades2010_Trabajo03.png Indicadores
de TRABAJO Y DESARROLLO ECONÃMICO] (2010). Observadores de resultados de gobier-
no. [https://www.ukmediacentre.pwc.com/imagelibrary/downloadMedia.ash-
x?MediaDetailsID=1562 Ciudades mÃ¡s ricas del mundo en 2008].
PricewaterhouseCoopers UK Economic Outlook. Noviembre de 2009. It is the
first most visited city in South America (ahead of Rio de Janeiro) as well as
the second most visited city across Latin America (behind Mexico City), [http://america.infobae.com/notas/52348-Ciudad-de-Mexico-
Buenos-Aires-y-San-Pablo-los-destinos-turisticos-favoritos Ciudad de MÃ©xico, Buenos-
Aires y San Pablo los destinos turÃ­sticos favoritos]. Infobae. and most
important, largest and most populous of South American capitals as well as the
Latin American Documentary "United by History" is the Paris of South
America.

People from Buenos Aires are referred to as [[porteÃ±os]] (people of the
port). Buenos Aires is a top tourist destination, and is
known for its European style architecture and rich cultural
life, with the highest concentration of theatres in the
world.

Buenos Aires is currently a candidate city to host the 2018 Summer Youth Olympics. [http://www.olympic.org/news/ioc-shortlists-three-candidate-
cities-for-2018-summer-youth-olympic-games/190784 IOC shortlists three Candidate
Cities for 2018 Summer Youth Olympic Games]
